Name: War Chess: Diplomacy of the Three Kingdoms
Description:
The Three Kingdoms period of China was a time when great characters rose to lead factions with the kingdoms of the day and eventually unite China under one dynasty through a series of military and diplomatic campaigns featuring temporary alliances, civil war and conquest. You are now one of those characters!

—description from the publisher
Families: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Name: Cows In My Pants
Description:
Be ready to moove along quickly in this funny, fast-paced card game.  Perfect for family or friends game night.  Build your deck to create a Corral of cows the fastest and declare yourself the Cows in my Pants winner! Be ready for an upset, as these cows have a mind of their own.

Barnyard Deck:
50 Comical Cows-10 Cows each in 5 suits (no, not business attire, the other suit)
5 Wild Cards: Barnyard friends ready to play along
15 Action Upset Cards to Keep everyone on their toes

Cows Rule:
Be the first player to create 4 of a kind, a flush, a run, or 2 pairs in your secret corral.  Score points according to what you and everyone else has in their hand when “Cows in my Pants!” is declared.

Play until a set amount of points, rounds or time limit. Have fun c’owning around!

—description from the publisher

Name: Gridlock
Description:
Gridlock is a pattern building game for 2 to 4 players.
All the action takes place on a 7x7 square wooden board.

Every turn you have to choose a wooden 2x2 square tile and place it on the board. These squares consist of randomly areas in the colors red, yellow, green and black.

Whenever you place a tile, you check whether you have created a larger area of any color and count the points.

Tiles may only be placed directly on the board or stacked if the top tile lies on at least 2 different tiles without falling off.

The game ends if there are no tiles left or no places to build anymore. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Target For Today: Axis Fighter Aircraft 1942-1945
Description:
Target For Today - Add-on Module
Axis Fighter Aircraft, 1942 - 1945

Target for Today is a solitaire game that recreates American's Daylight Strategic Bombing Campaign against Nazi Occupied Europe during the Second World War. This add-on module introduces Axis fighter from Italy, Romania, and Hungary.

—description from the publisher

Name: Formula: Genius Edition
Description: The expansion has roughly the same rules as the base game, but adds fractions, negative numbers and more operators so (longer) equations on both sides of the '=' can be made. It also gives the option to use square and square root.

Name: Four To Score
Description:
Four To Score is a dynamic word search game played on a 4x4 grid. Players stack letters to make and score four-letter words in any direction. As letters are stacked and unstacked, new words game be continually formed.

The Lasercut game consists of a six-inch game board and 100 single-letter tiles.

Players strategically stack and unstack tiles, scoring any four-letter words found until someone exceeds a predetermined target score.

Can be played solitaire.

—description from the publisher

Name: Olde English Chivalry Game
Description:
A game played on a board of 9 × 9 squares, for up to four adults or children.

Each player selects a gaming character (Jester, Poet, Prince, Knight) and places the appropriate standee piece on the applicable starting square located at the corners of the board (Jester's Court, Poet's Corner, Prince's Palace, Knight's Castle).  A neutral Princess playing piece is placed on the Castle square in the centre of the board.

There are a number of plastic chips representing gold and silver coins (seemingly three of each) which are placed in a provided draw bag labelled "Olde English Swag Bag".

Players then take turns in drawing a coin out of the bag, and moving their piece accordingly.  Coins are of two types - silver and gold - and the player must move his piece to a square of the same kind that is adjacent to the one he is on (orthogonally - no diagonal moves are allowed). If a legal move is available, it must be made, even if the player feels it is disadvantageous; if no legal move is available, the player does not move his piece.  The coin is then returned to the bag, and play passes to the next player.

The object of the game is to rescue the trapped princess from the castle, and to be the first to carry her away to safety.

As well as the four corner squares, Princess's central castle, and gold and silver coin squares, other spaces are marked with taverns, witches, fighters in various poses, a dragon (occupying 5 squares), fallen log (2 squares), broken bridge (2 squares), and ?river gorge (3 squares).  The purpose of these squares is unknown.  Also unknown is why the game appears to be equipped with a total of nine character pieces, some of which appear to be duplicates.

Also known as Gaymer's Old English Chivalry Game - the manufacturers of Gaymer's Olde English Cyder also promoted a Compendium of "Inne Games" at about the same time, comprising dominoes, a cribbage board, two packs of cards, and poker dice.

—user summary

Name: Bugball
Description: Bugball is a two-play, fast-paced and fun fantasy football game where individual characters battle to determine which team can score more goals than their opponent. Do you trust speed, power or accurate launch?

Name: Kalewala: Tale of Sampo
Description:
Setting: The epic poetry of Kalevala was originally published in 1835, and has since inspired e.g. J.R.R. Tolkien. Kalevala and its 50 runes have been translated to over 60 languages, but it's mythological world is still unused as a board game theme. The game mostly focuses in the most well-known tale from Kalevala, the rune regarding the capturing of the legendary artifact called Sampo.

Description: Kalewala: Tale of Sampo puts players in two opposing teams controlling fascinating demi-gods in an immersive narrative set on the epoch of Kalevala. The tense interactions are amplified by the use of a vertical game board separating the two sides and by a clever hidden movement mechanism utilizing magnetic pieces on its central map. Use your limited card resources wisely, as they diminish rapidly, simultaneously revealing information to the opposing side. The earlier decisions during gameplay will bite or reward you on the inevitable event of game's combats!

Victory terms: The side of Vainola tries to reach their home, but only the Sampo-bearer (comparable to the significance of the Ring in LOTR) can win the game by reaching the pre-chosen destination. The other side, Pohjola, aims to deduce their current location from Vainola's movements in order to challenge the Sampo-bearer to combat. The game is played in a maximum of 12 rounds utilizing the trap components of Pohjola as a dynamic timer, with Pohjola winning if the Trap deck gets depleted.

Number of players: 1-6, can be played with up to 12 players with two game copies

Target audience: Players interested in flexible strategies, interaction and thematic tension, prior gaming background isn't mandatory

Level of difficulty: Medium (BGG scale), the rules can be learned in 5-10 minutes before starting and while playing but players need to be analytical or focused during gameplay.

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Return to the Forgotten Age
Description:
The flow of time itself is convoluted, and though you thought you had left the jungles of southern Mexico and the depths of Yoth behind you, it appears that they are not as far away as they might seem. Like a snake eating its own tail, the timeline is looping back around itself again…

With the Return to the Forgotten Age upgrade expansion for Arkham Horror: The Card Game, you’ll find new scenario cards and encounter sets that you can insert into every scenario of The Forgotten Age, mixing up your investigations with new dangers and new objectives. New player cards, representing upgraded versions of cards from The Forgotten Age give you new tools and options for upgrading your decks. And with a full assortment of card dividers, you’ll be able to easily sort and store your entire campaign. Will you venture once more into the jungle?

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Forgotten Age
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Black Party: Der Tod des Paten
Description:
In Black Party the players embody figures who are involved into a spectacular murder case. One of the players is the murderer. But the others also have their dirty secrets or a motive and each of them have an extra task that only they know.
The group decides by guessing and reconstructing the crime who is the murderer and afterwards the players see if the group was on the right track. So it's about getting away with life. Because what good is it to be innocent if the others think you are guilty?

In Black Party - Der Tod des Paten the players are members of a mafia in Montemare. 
One day the godfather is shot from a passing Fiat as he leaves the church. Who is the murderer?

Name: Black Party: Ruhe in Frieden, Sherlock
Description:
In Black Party the players embody figures who are involved into a spectacular murder case. One of the players is the murderer. But the others also have their dirty secrets or a motive and each of them have an extra task that only they know.
The group decides by guessing and reconstructing the crime who is the murderer and afterwards the players see if the group was on the right track. So it's about getting away with life. Because what good is it to be innocent if the others think you are guilty?

In Black Party - Ruhe in Frieden, Sherlock the world-famous detective Sherlock Holmes was strangled on his way home from his favorite opium den in a cab. Who is the murderer?

Name: Black Party: Das Varieté des Todes
Description:
In Black Party the players embody figures who are involved into a spectacular murder case. One of the players is the murderer. But the others also have their dirty secrets or a motive and each of them have an extra task that only they know.
The group decides by guessing and reconstructing the crime who is the murderer and afterwards the players see if the group was on the right track. So it's about getting away with life. Because what good is it to be innocent if the others think you are guilty?

In Black Party - The Variety of Death, the variety artist Loulou Lalouche dies in a particularly cruel manner: her tame boa Constictor, with whom she performs a seductive dance, strangled her on the open stage. Who is the murderer?

Name: Undercover Turbo Duckies
Description:
STORYLINE
Welcome guys! You are the brand new members of the Turbo Duckies, the prestigious intergalactic bounty hunting team!
 Travel through space incognito, behind the wheel of your food truck and prepare to face hordes of Zenemies and Bosses, each one more powerful and delirious than the last!

THE GAME
Undercover Turbo Duckies offers a scalable gaming system, entirely composed of cards.

Campaign mode (Non-destructive legacy): the very first time you open the box, many elements are hidden and will be unlocked as you progress through the original adventure.
So, once you've finished the main mode, you'll be able to fully rediscover the game with new ways to play and new characters!
Unlock the 1v1 mode, and Overlord Mode: one player plays 4-of-all bosses!

Play through 20 episodes, defeat all your Zenemies and bosses, collect SeedZ accoss the galaxy and make the perfect bounty hunting team!

Name: Cat and Mice: Allez-hop
Description:
In Cat and Mice, the players try to place their four mice on the cheese swing, building a mouse pyramid. Successful placement is rewarded with point tokens.

—user summary

Name: Colt Express: Promo Cards
Description: 13 cards for Colt Express. Although they were distributed separately as promo cards (at Brussels Game Festival 2019), these cards are identical to the Round and Train Station cards from Colt Express: Marshal & Prisoners.

Name: Squadron Strike!: Ship Book 1
Description:
Ship Book 1 for Squadron Strike features class histories, specifications, fully-rendered illustrations, and Ship Data Sheets for 15 ships from the Human Diaspora setting.

If you're a fan of naval architecture, and gorgeous art of spaceships, this is the book for you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Squadron Strike!: Material Condition Deck
Description:
This is an expansion of the table that appears on page 125 on the Squadron Strike rulebook, done as a custom deck of cards.

What these cards do is add complications to ships in space combat games, color coded by type.  
They can also be used for setting up initial conditions for RPG adventures, say with Star Trek Adventures.

Some scenarios in Squadron Strike will tell you to draw cards from the deck before the scenario starts to show the impact of ships being on the tail end of long patrols, and they functionally act like random terrain in making scenarios more interesting.

—description from the publisher

Name: Book It!: The Pro Wrestling Promoter Card Game – The Gorilla Expansion
Description:
Step Into Gorilla

The first expansion for Book It! adds over seventy new cards and a brand new mechanic: Production Cards! Work towards hidden objectives that will boost your bankroll, reputation, or give you other helpful bonuses!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ocean
Description:
This game consists of a box with holes in the lid, 15 sticks and 12 magnets. The bottom of the box is a metal plate.

The game can be played in four ways.


    Fishing:


One player places the magnets. The other player tries to hit the magnets with the sticks.


    Treasure hunt:


One player places the magnets in four lines of three. The other player tries to hit the magnets with the sticks.


    The boat game:


One player places the magnets as they wish, but with at least one empty spot between eacn. The other player tries to get across the board without hitting the magnets with the sticks.


    Stepping stones:


One player places the magnets forming a path. The other player tries to get across the board missing the magnets as little as possible. For a harder game, also place a false path.

—user summary

Name: Saviors of the Sea
Description:
A card game of Somali pirates.

From the Indian Ocean and the Gulf of Aden into the Arabian Sea, small groups of Somali nationals are challenging international shipping traffic. While many call them pirates others see them as badaadinta badah: saviors of the sea. In either case, being financially viable is crucial to survival. In the Saviors of the Sea game you and others play as leaders of different Somali factions fighting to capture and ransom vessels that enter your valuable ocean territory.

SOS is a card-driven game where players use cards to aid their hijacking attempts or to impair other players in their attempts. Players use skiffs to attack vessels such as oil tankers, cargo ships, and yachts that fly the flags of other nations or unions. Every ship and nationality has its own value for ransom and help comes from many quarters including foreign intelligence groups. But be warned, foreign powers include things such as Special Forces units and naval operations.

—description from the designer;;

Name: Conan: The Conqueror
Description:
Not only is the Adventure Mode (our original one vs many system) gameplay you know and love making its return, but we’re also adding a revised version of the solo/co-op rules featured in Conan: The Monolith Sourcebook. Regardless of which version of Conan you own or plan to purchase, all of the new content will pair perfectly with what you have.

With the new mega-Conqueror expansion you’ll be able to enter the savage worlds and raise your own bloodied sword.

—description from the publisher

Name: Conan: Tome of Skelos
Description:
This 80 page hardcover book was part of the "Conan the Conqueror" Kickstarter, in the style of previous Conan hardcover titles. Copyright 2020. All pledges for the Conqueror box (base pledge thru the more expensive options) included this book.

The book includes:
- 8 brand new scenarios for the original Conan Adventure mode (one vs many mode) that make use of all the new miniatures, maps and tiles.
- 11 brand new Solo/Coop style scenarios where players will choose their heroes, gather equipment, and gain powerful Boons to complete their escape across the Pictish Wilderness.  
- An updated version of the solo/co-op rules that debuted in the Conan: The Monolith Sourcebook 
- Brand new artwork created for this campaign.

Name: Conan: Tales of the Red Brotherhood
Description:
The pirates of the Red Brotherhood have spread out from the Baracha Isles and haunt every shore of the Western Sea. It is said they have even raised sail on the inland waters of the Vilayet. This organization, composed mainly of Argosseans, maintains a notorious rivalry with the Zingaran Freebooters, and their bloody feuds have turned the tides a deeper shade of crimson.

These are tales of high seas and high adventure. These are the tales of the Red Brotherhood.

Fred Henry is returning to the design table and cooking up four new Adventure Mode scenarios. These exciting adventures make use of the brand new double-sided pirate ship game boards and only require the core/retail version of Conan AND the all-new contents featured in the Conan the Conqueror expansion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rifles in the Peninsula: The Duel
Description:
This minigame, inspired by the movie The Duelist, is an optional set of rule for Rifles in the Peninsula that allows you to introduce a more personal perspective to the game.

—description from the rulebook

The Dual is a minigame that is played between scenarios of the Rifles in the Peninsula's Campaign Game.  The game consists of checking initiative, stamina and wounds after each attack and defense during a duel between the player and the Nemesis.

—user summary

Name: Harry Potter: I'm Going to Hogwarts
Description:
I'm going to Hogwarts is a Harry Potter themed card game based on the classic children's memory game "I went to market"..

Players take to turns to recite all the previous items packed for the trip to Hogwarts before drawing a new card and adding it to the list. If someone makes a mistake all other players, in reverse order, take a item from the list to add to their trunk, where they are trying to collect their 4 unique items.

— user description

Name: Doctor Who: Race to the TARDIS
Description:
Players take control of one of 6 recent incarnations of the Doctor, moving around the time vortex, in an attempt to collect the 3 missing TARDIS components. Along the way players will encounter some of the Doctors' companions and some well known enemies.

— user description

Name: Kaiju Attack
Description:
A cooperative tower defense game in which players attempt to prevent the Kaiju from destroying the last standing cities.

The game includes 180 cards, including Kaiju, Generals, Cities, and Resources.

Each turn, players will draw resource cards, build and deploy weapons, and attack the Kaiju. Players are encouraged to play cooperatively, trading resources (especially when they begin to become scarce), planning strategies, and combining attacks to deal the most damage to the Kaiju each round.

The Kaiju will then take a turn, destroying the city and stomping the weapons the players have built. Each Kaiju has a special ability that makes them harder to kill. As they crush the cities underfoot, resources become harder to get, making it more difficult to build and deploy weapons).

The game is won when all the Kaiju are dead and there are still cities left standing. The game is lost if the Kaiju destroy all remaining cities.

—description from the designer

Name: A Charlie Brown Christmas: Christmas Journey
Description:
You have been chosen by Charlie Brown to help discover the true meaning of Christmas. The celebrations can't start until Charlie Brown and the gang return with the greatest Christmas tree in all the land. Gather your friends as you all journey through an icy winter wonderland. Remember, it's not what's under the Christmas tree that matters, it's who's around it. Who will be the first to help Charlie Brown?

Enjoy this entertaining Peanuts game brimming with Charlie, Snoopy, Linus, Sally, and all the gang as they make their way along this winter journey. Now, you can celebrate the Christmas spirit any day of the year.

—description from the publisher

Name: Victory by Any Means: 1793-1801 Caribbean Campaign Compendium
Description:
This campaign expansion for VBAM: Fire As She Bears! Edition puts players in control of the Admiralty of Britain, France or Spain in the West Indies during the French Revolutionary Wars of 1793-1801.

Players will battle for supremacy in the Caribbean in this scenario

Name: ToppleRocks Challenge
Description:
A set of 6 irregularly shaped angular blocks that stacks in an unstable fashion.  Players take turns building structures from the blocks under time pressure from a sand timer.  Points are awarded for including many blocks, stacking two blocks on one block, and placing larger rocks atop smaller rocks.  Multiple sets can be combined to create larger structures.

The boxed edition under the title "ToppleRocks Challenge" includes a timer, scoring rules, and is packaged as a game for 2+ players.  The bagged edition under the title "ToppleRocks" does not include scoring rules or a timer and advertises itself as a building toy.

The blocks are manufactured from scrap wood, so the materials and coloration varies from set to set.

Name: DeepWars: Core Rules
Description:
The original underwater tabletop skirmish game! Deepwars is the only miniatures game where you can have tabletop battles below the waves of a lost underground sea in search of ancient treasures. Players can choose from different distinct forces, from humans in steampunk dive suit to savage merfolk and mysterious high-tech warriors of Atalán. Games are played with small sides so players do not need to invest in massive armies, just specialized warbands of personality characters and troops, and can be played in an hour. Take your forces into sunken shipwrecks, shark-infested reefs and lost cities in campaigns of multiple scenarios where each member of a warband can gain advancements as they win battles and gather treasure. But beware of wild creatures that roam the Shadow Sea, as they have their own AI rules that allow them to hunt any model on the board, hungry for blood. The book comes complete with all of the core rules as well as descriptions of all weapons, armor, tech artifacts, magic and special abilities for all characters and has the roster for the four main forces as well as all wild sea creatures. In addition, it includes a section detailing the different environments that players can explore and do battle within and descriptions of all of the different terrain types that can be encountered. Finally, there is a complete toolkit in the back that shows how to build your own custom characters or edit existing ones using a simple point calculation system.


     RULES BASED ON AWARD-WINNING SONG OF BLADES AND HEROES by Ganesha Games but with extensive additional rules, weapons, armor, technology items (akin to magic items) and new combat and movement options. Deepwars include a detailed combat system and multiple combat options with wound tracking for different body part or subsystems. The activation system allows players to choose a basic free action or gamble on rolling dice for more complex actions. Game cards for miniatures are tarot sized (4.75 by 2.75 inch), giving room to include all of the descriptions of Special Abilities, Weapons, Armor and Tech Items. This means much less referencing the rulebook and faster gameplay for all. Sets of game cards can be downloaded in PDF format in the Download section of the website.
     3D GAMEPLAY: In Deepwars, all models are capable of swimming or movement through the water column, which gives the game a distinct three-dimensional feel. Model can pass over and under each other using specific Depth Levels, which are indicated by markers or on a clear acrylic Swim Stand (available in the AMG store). Rules are included for movement across depth levels, where hasty changes in depth can cause deadly barotrauma. There are also rules for the effects of variable visibility and light levels and for models that can easily navigate through the darkness using echolocation.
     INTENSE COMBAT, MAGIC AND TECHNOLOGY in the abyssal depths of the Sea. Breach submarines, uncover undersea temples, battle with schools of sharks and dodge torpedoes while recovering artifacts that hold the secrets of the ethereal void. Spellcasters can wield multiple magical spell types, including elemental magic that causes hydrothermal eruptions and dimensional magic that allows unsavory spellcasters to call forth beings from the ethereal void. Scientists can discover artifacts with tremendous power or design and improve upon their own ether technology to upgrade and create new items.
     SKIRMISH WITH RPG FLAVOR: Combination of 28mm scale miniature tabletop wargame with campaign advancement and a role-playing flavor. The game can be played in single sessions of an hour, or as a campaign where warbands salvage ancient technology, design their own new tech items, enhance abilities and generally become powerful lords of the deep.
     FOUR COMPETING FORCES: Battle with four unique forces below the waves. The human Fortune Hunters are encased in diving suits and utilize salvaged technology to help them control the seas. The Dark Mariners are corrupted beings that summon ethereal beings from the dimensional void. The Ancients of Atalán are the remnants of an advanced undersea civilization trying to reclaim their former glory. The Scaly Horde is a loosely organized faction of scaly draconids, fish-men and monstrous creatures that intend to expand their control of the sea, while earning gold selling their services to other forces.
     TOURNAMENT RULES – The rulebook has an entire section on running tournaments, complete with scoring and timekeeping, as well as new Special Operations that each player gets for a scenario. The Spec-Ops are special missions that a warband can accomplish during a scenario to gain bonus Victory Points.


—description from the publisher

Name: Streaks & Ladders
Description:
Do you like fun, games, and public nudity? Well then, get ready for this race n' chase game where nudity wins! You and three other players run around the Tri-Piques Waterpark With one goal, experience every attraction the park has to offer and escape, all while streaking and avoiding capture by the lifeguard.

Players take turns rolling and moving about the board in a non-linear fashion. The goal is to reach each of the ten locations on the board. Some spots on the board require one to draw a 'Flasher' card which can cause the player to move locations, miss a turn, escape from jail, ect. Once they have done so they may mark it off of the scorecard. Once all ten locations have been visited, the player must escape the park via one of it's two exits. One player plays as the lifeguard. His objective is to chase down each player. Once he has reached a player, both are moved to the jail. The lifeguard then continues on to try and catch the others. Players can be let out of jail by others if they can reach the jailhouse location on the board. The game ends when either everyone has escaped or everyone is captured. The winners are those who escaped or the lifeguard if anyone remained captured at the end.

—description from the publisher

Name: Skateland
Description:
Do you have what it takes to dominate on skates? You and up to three of your friends will go head to head to see who is the most x-treme aggressive inline skater of them all.

Move about the board (a run-down skate park) finding places to pull off tricks. Once you've found a spot, play a trick card and note its point value. If you can, play a trick multiplier, like a grab or a spin, to add to your base trick points. Then roll to multiply those points. Watch out! If your trick is too complicated, there's a risk you might take damage. Too much damage and you're out. Your opponent gaining too much of a lead? Play a trap card to sabotage them. First player to 10,000 points wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Dirt Track Saturday Night: The Starting Field Expansion
Description:
This is the product that makes Dirt Track Saturday Night even more fun to play, plus much more convenient and economical to own. 
The counter set is designed to fit the full size track as well as the medium and small versions of the track. 
This makes DTSN the most accessible and enjoyable racing game on the market. 
This product does require that you have the full set of rules for Dirt Track Saturday Night.

The full color car counters are based on actual race cars from the 1960's and onward. The rut markers change the racing surface so that each racer must choose his line with greater care. The variable number and location of the ruts means that each race will be unique in its own right. Whether you play a single race, one night's worth of races or a season of races, the decisions you make will matter even more. The best part is that the rut rules are an extended application of the existing rules; not a change.

Dirt Track Saturday Night is very playable, yet challenging. The Starting Field Expansion just adds more of that "it just feels right" character that all gamers desire.

—description from the publisher

Name: Moments of Sheer Terror: Core Rules. Mid 20th Century – Mid 21st Century
Description:
Warfare has been described as protracted boredom punctuated by moments of sheer terror.

The core rules of Moments of Sheer Terror are focused on the individual infantry of the mid 20th century to the mid 21st century. Blaster weapons as well as conventional slug throwers are the stock in trade of the infantry in this time period. Fixed wing and rotary wing aircraft are included. Futuristic vehicles such as grav boards that hover 6 to 12 inches above the ground are available as well for individual troopers.

Moments of Sheer Terror is a skirmish level game that operates on an initiative based system for the troops to take action. When you take certain actions, such as firing a weapon, there is a chance that one of 64 random events will occur. Some events will help you, other events will help your opponent.

The rules are written to avoid vertical exaggeration by having the figure scale match the ground scale. Buildings, trees and other features are meant to be played as they are modeled. 
There are charts included for 6mm, 10mm, 15mm, 20mm, 25mm and 28mm figures.

One turn equals 30 seconds. 
The combination of the ground scale and turn length means that air support is handled with elegant simplicity. (In 6mm scale a soldier figure moves 6 inches in one turn. A ground attack aircraft would move 88 feet.) Just choose the altitude; high or low. Then put the aircraft where you want it on the table.

The charts are where the detail is in the game. This means the core rules can be used for different eras with slight modification for that era.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ratas de la Patria
Description:
Homeland CongressRats
The congress of a fictitious republic has run out of president due to political scandals. Now the dirtiest congressrats will try to be elected as president of the congress. For this, as the leader of a politician party, you must not hesitate to bribe other congressrats to join your political party and thus achieve a majority within the congress to win the election.
But take care of your rivals who will not hesitate to open legal investigations against you and take your congressmen to their own political parties. You should also be aware of the mass media that can put public opinion against you, and so, restricting your moves.

Manage your available options and try to stay a step forward than your political rivals. Try to get more political power to empower your tactics and gain more followers in a single move. And make a good use of your special corrupt power to obtain a crushing victory.

Are you ready to be the filthiest rat in the congress? Do you want to obtain power and become the next congress president? Then come and play this game that it's definitely not inspired by a latin American country.

—description from the designer

Name: Quick Intermediate Level Skirmish
Description:
Quick Intermediate Level Skirmish or QILS is a simple and quick skirmish level wargaming system.

It supports multiple genres of gaming, based on supplements.

Out of the box (well, the .pdf) it is ready to play with a few suggested sides and scenarios.

The current genre supplement is for a fantasy world (which has a lot of nice material, ready to transfer over to another system), with upcoming releases for scifi and pulp adventure!

—description from the publisher

Name: SINS: Gloom of Greed – Battle Pack
Description:
SINS is a fantasy card deck-builder with a quick setup and gameplay, filled with a plethora of combos and tough choices throughout the game, in a small package.

To win, gain power, give despair and resolve your dominance.

Components
70 x SINS cards.
20 x Kosmos (starter) cards.
2 x Dominance cards.
5 x rules cards.
3 x misc. cards.

Setup
Each box supports 2 players. Use multiple boxes when playing with more than 2 players.

Deal 10 Kosmos (starter) cards to each player. This is their draw pile, placed in their play area.

Give each player a Dominance card and place it with the Cortadoo logo facing up.

Shuffle all Sins cards together face-down, from the box sets of your choice. Place the cards in the center of the table to form the Realm.

Each player draws a card from the top of the Realm. The highest card-number is the active player (repeat if there is a tie). Destroy these cards. Destroyed cards are placed back in the box.

Then, draw 5 cards from the top of the Realm, into the center of the table, face-up.

All players draw 5 starting cards into their hand from their draw pile (this is their hand limit).

The active player starts the game and takes their first turn.
How to win
When a player reaches two dominance, that player wins the game and the game ends immediately.

You get dominance by resolving opposing despair in the Status phase, and you give despair by attacking your opponents in the Attack phase.

The Dominance card in front of each player has numbers from zero to three. If you’d like to play a longer game, you can optionally play until a player reaches three dominance. For a short (coffee break) game, play for one dominance.

Name: SINS: Ooze of Gluttony – Battle Pack
Description:
SINS is a fantasy card deck-builder with a quick setup and gameplay, filled with a plethora of combos and tough choices throughout the game, in a small package.

To win, gain power, give despair and resolve your dominance.

Components
70 x SINS cards.
20 x Kosmos (starter) cards.
2 x Dominance cards.
5 x rules cards.
3 x misc. cards.

Setup
Each box supports 2 players. Use multiple boxes when playing with more than 2 players.

Deal 10 Kosmos (starter) cards to each player. This is their draw pile, placed in their play area.

Give each player a Dominance card and place it with the Cortadoo logo facing up.

Shuffle all Sins cards together face-down, from the box sets of your choice. Place the cards in the center of the table to form the Realm.

Each player draws a card from the top of the Realm. The highest card-number is the active player (repeat if there is a tie). Destroy these cards. Destroyed cards are placed back in the box.

Then, draw 5 cards from the top of the Realm, into the center of the table, face-up.

All players draw 5 starting cards into their hand from their draw pile (this is their hand limit).

The active player starts the game and takes their first turn.
How to win
When a player reaches two dominance, that player wins the game and the game ends immediately.

You get dominance by resolving opposing despair in the Status phase, and you give despair by attacking your opponents in the Attack phase.

The Dominance card in front of each player has numbers from zero to three. If you’d like to play a longer game, you can optionally play until a player reaches three dominance. For a short (coffee break) game, play for one dominance.

Description:

Components
70 x SINS cards.

2 x Dominance cards.
5 x rules cards.
3 x misc. cards.

Give each player a Dominance card and place it with the Cortadoo logo facing up.
