Name: Haywire
Description:
There is a problem with the robot crew of the SSPS Awesomer Gossamer.  For some reason, they seem intent on crashing the ship, and its 70 teraton cargo of radioactive waste, into the Earth.  Fortunately, Space Patrol is at hand to avert the catastrophe! Your mission is to take a small boarding party, weave through their defenses undetected, and shut them down before they turn Earth into a cinder.

This supplement for Quick Intermediate Level Skirmish, our free gaming system pits two teams of players against each other with blasters blazing, cargo pods exploding, and if you're daring enough, blasting the shuttle engines in the hangar bay!

The 73 page booklet contains:

     Full QILS stats for Space Patrol teams (with hundreds of options) and robots
     Four configurable ships layouts with thousands of replay variants
     Over 40 pages 2D and optional 3D (simple) terrain so you can print and play
     Solo play rules


Special Bonus!

Haywire includes the solo game Devil to Pay.
You are a new recruit to Space Patrol, and what better place to see the galaxy than outside the skin of the ship where you will have to dodge well-intentioned (?) robots, meteors, disgorging trash, and other hazards to get your routine maintenance done?

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Dark Side Rising – Promo Pack
Description:
Set of 8 promo cards that came with pre-ordered and early copies from FLGS.

The 8 cards inside the promo pack are:

2 red Rebel Heros: Bo-Katan Kryze and PAO
1 green Rebel Hero: Bistan
1 purple Rebel Hero: General Merrick
1 green Rebel vehicle: A-Wing
1 blue Rebel vehicle: Phantom II
1 purple Imperial Villain: Shoretrooper
1 purple Imperial vehicle: Delta Class T-3C

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Land of Sorrow
Description:
Your journey nears its end in The Land of Sorrow, the fifth Adventure Pack in the Vengeance of Mordor cycle for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game!

After making your way through the treacherous Tunnels of Torech Gorgor, you find yourself in Mordor at last. But before you make your way to Thane Ulchor's fortress of Dol Rhugar, you decide to risk everything to free prisoners made to harvest crops and livestock to feed Sauron's armies. As you do, you'll be locked in combat with the strongest Easterling characters you have faced thus far. Can you successfully lead the revolt and overthrow these cruel slavers?

To help you in this task, this 60-card Adventure Pack also contains plenty of new player cards that increase your deckbuilding options, including a new Eagle hero and a contract that unlocks even more potential in one of your allies.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Card Story: Journey
Description:
It’s time to hit the road and start an adventure.
Choose your way and reveal the cards of destiny.
Travel to the Legendary City and get your magical reward at the end of your journey.

Rules are that simple:

     Draw your mode of transport.
     Decide, where to go.
     Discover your adventure.
     Get your reward.
     Calculate your score!
     Tell your story!


Almost 20 000 stories possible
54 unique cards

Gameplay example:

Natalia draws the Magic Carpet – no one has faster transport, so she starts. She decides to go into the woods.
She meets the Beast, and draws the next card. The Beast is asleep, so she can take it's treasure.
She draws another card – and is visiting the Magic Palace. She draws again – and Magical Unicorn appears.
As a prize Natalia gets Seven-league Boots.

Card Story is a unique "choose your own story" card game. 
You can tell the stories again and again, each time creating different combinations.

—description from the designer

Name: The Big Black Pig Escape (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
Description:
Fan made expansion for Carcassonne.

It adds 2 new tiles.
You can move big black pig only if you are the last player on the scorepad. Try to catch the big black pig.

Name: Allenstein
Description:
This is a quick to play, high level set up for the Battle of Tannenberg (which happened closer to Allenstein), which happened at the outset of World War One.

This is not a detailed combat simulation but a simple scenario to explore the command and control advantage that contributed to a greatly outnumbered and outgunned German force in routing the Russians at the operational and strategic levels.

Rough OOB, QILS stats, and a general map are provided.

The set up is simple enough that you should be able to easily substitute troops from any other genre.

Name: A Season in Hel
Description:
A Season in Hel supplement provides a short science-fiction campaign for control of a strategically critical spaceport, Hel.

There are three main battles, the optional ones (depending on choice, and how things go), and a one-off adventure/encounter set in the Hel milieu.  
Each of the main battles also provides a way to set up force outside the campaign environment.

The scenarios are written as a supplement for Quick Intermediate Level Skirmish, our free rule set.  
We also provide guidelines for picking equivalent forces from other gaming systems, if you want.

The pdf contains:

     Seven scenarios, with set up, terrain diagram, and victory conditions
     Twenty pages of 2D and 3D terrain pieces to cover all the Scenarios
     Stats for infantry, armour, air cavalry, and naval guns in QILS
     Weather


The weather system in A Season in Hel is the crowning jewel of the game.  
It is quick and simple to play (no tables, charts, or nomograms), yet provides a robust, unpredictable, yet logical meteorological environment to beat on your troops as they beat on each other.  
There are even a dozen options for adapting the weather system to other environments like desert, derelect space station, and the toxic atmosphere of Venus (or another like planet).

—description from the publisher

Name: Infected
Description:
Infected is a collaborative-competitive horror adventure for up to six players to control the scientist survivors of a savage disease outbreak on an isolated Antarctic station.  The adventure is collaborative because you will have to work together if anyone is to make it to the hangar bay and safety.  It is competitive because there is no way everyone will make it out.  There is also a victory objective to compete with the other survivors to be the "hero" of the event in the public's eye, rather than just a survivor.

The major obstacle to getting out is disease-infected former colleagues with a newly acquired taste for blood.  These monsters are controlled by a set of behavioural rules, so you can even play the game solo.  By trying to maximize hero points and minimize how infected the survivors become, there is good replay solo value as you try to beat your best performance.  
And in team play, there are rules for eliminated players to take over the monsters ... Yeah, thanks guys.  I'll show you my, "Let Dave go in first!" now ...

The .pdf comes with the following:

Complete setup for 4-5 encounters in the complex - maps, laydowns, situational rules.
    QILS stats for bad guys and good guys (six scientists, and two arctic guides), plus guidelines to convert from our free QILS game to any other gaming system.
    Simple A-Frame paper figures for the monsters and survivors (in case you don't have a bunch of 28mm scientists in parkas lying around).
    Modular 2D and simple to construct optional 3D terrain templates for everything you need to run the adventure (and they're pretty useful for other industrial environments, too).

—description from the publisher

Name: Gladiator Wrecks
Description:
Gladitor Wrecks is a beer-and-pretzels card-driven game of arena combat cars. 
 It is designed to provide three to twenty players a gear-grinding, car-flipping frenzy of metal and violence.  There aren't detailed hit tracking sheets, page upon page of options, doo-dads, and gizmos, and complex intermeshing rules.

If you want to be an automotive engineer, this isn't your game.  But if you want drop a toy car on the board an accelerate into oblivion, we have the game for you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Filmpärlor
Description:
Can't you pass a mirror without saying "You talkin' to me?". Do you remember how the Joker got his scar and do you know what a Quarter Pounder with cheese is called in France? Then this is the game for you.

This game contains 60 questions, in addition to a category tile, that can be used as a standalone game, or to expand your Bezzerwizzer game with this new category.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: The Woman's Game Trivia Card Set
Description:
This trivia card set is designed to be played as a stand alone game, or as a companion to to such related games as Avalon Hill's Game of Trivia and Selchow & Richter's Trivial Pursuit.

Contains six categories: Pandora's Box, Fashion & Fitness, Relationships, Careers, Herstory, The Home Front

"Sugar and spice. Naughty and nice. Making it, faking it, not laying back and taking it. Thats what The Women's Game is made of."

—description from the back of the box

Name: Isles of Terror: Wokou Faction Expansion
Description:
Adds a fifth player (sixth if you have the Kolonial Korps). 
Contains 7 faction strategy cards, 1 faction ship card, 2 event cards, 1 mission card, faction sheet, faction player board, linen bag, extra resource & success tokens, faction specific action tokens and wooden components for this faction.

Contains the specified amount of cards in both German and English.

Name: Isles of Terror: Kolonial Korps Faction Expansion
Description:
Adds a fifth player (sixth if you have the Wokou). 
Contains 7 faction strategy cards, 1 faction ship card, 2 event cards, 1 mission card, faction sheet, faction player board, linen bag, extra resource & success tokens, faction specific action tokens and wooden components for this faction.

Contains the specified amount of cards in both German and English.

Name: Ludington's Ride
Description:
Ludington’s Ride is an educational boardgame for the entire family. Up to eight players compete as Sybil Ludington, who makes her legendary ride to call out Lt. Colonel Henry Ludington’s Seventh Regiment Militia of Dutchess County, New York, to confront the British Army after the burning of Danbury in April of 1777.

Mode of Play
Riders follow a route map, incrementing their movements by the throw of a die. Movement is therefore limited to six spaces, with bonus spaces earned if a Dispatch Card is played.

Playing Time
Playing time with eight players will take about an hour.

The Route Map
Riders follow a route map which is loosely based on Sybil Ludington’s legendary ride.[1] The route map is divided into a series of 72 spaces plus the Ludington Mill and the Ludington Home (where the game starts and ends).

Some of the spaces include houses of the soldiers that are to be mustered during Sybil’s ride. These spaces include a house icon. A white space with an icon is the house of a Company Captain. If a Captain is mustered, the entire company is deemed to be mustered.

Six spaces on the game board require the Rider to draw a Dispatch Card to determine what occurs after the Rider lands on the space.

Ten spaces on the game board require the Rider to draw a History Card. Up to 100 additional points can be earned by correctly answering the cards.

Name: Isles of Terror: The Emerald Brood Expansion
Description:
A new set of adventures and components to discover the Black Rock Isle and face an ancient nameless horror.

Contains 1 adventure book, 1 terror board, 36 exploration cards, 20 minion cards, 6 location cards, 6 location tiles, 3 terror tokens, 3 terror level tokens, 9 scenario tokens and 15 ritual tokens.

Contains the specified amount of cards and the adventure book in both German and English.

—description from publisher

Name: Isles of Terror: The Eight-Legged Goddess Expansion
Description:
Sticky webs and poisonous spiders are not the only threats hat await you in the new set of adventures.

Contains 1 adventure book, 1 terror board, 36 exploration cards, 20 minion cards, 6 location cards, 6 location tiles, 3 terror tokens, 3 terror level tokens, 1 scenario token and 46 poison, antidote and web tokens.

Contains the specified amount of cards and the adventure book in both German and English.

—description from publisher

Name: Isles of Terror: Tales from the Isles of Terror Expansion
Description:
New single adventures to use with the components of the base game and its expansions. Note that each adventure is also fully adjustable to play with the components of the base game or any other adventure set.

Contains the adventure book in both German and English.

—description from publisher

Name: Ace Goodknight and Penny Dreadfull in The Case of the Green Elephant
Description:
Ace Goodknight is back and this time he has a partner?  Well, a collaborator.  
Of sorts.  
Ace has been hired by Mr. Akwyrer to find his missing rare jade elephant.  
But Akwyrer has also hired Penny Dreadfull, proper, British, clever, and a thorn in Ace's side.  
Together, they will face weird carnies, panicked crowds, fearless flunkies, and the law in pursuit of the evil mastermind, Yu Noh Hu and his trusted companions Lo Fat and Tan Kyu!

This adventure will place two players together in a competitive/collaborative race to solve the case and return the Green Elephant.  
While each player is trying to grab the glory for themselves, they will also have to work together, if they want to avoid total defeat.

These scenarios contain:

     a total of seven system independent skirmish scenarios 
     2D and 3D paper terrain templates so you can print and play right away
     tailored stats for our free QILS system
     guidelines to substitute another system for QILS
     solo play options for the head-to-head scenarios
     samples of the worst dialogue and most hackneyed writing you have ever laid eyes on!


—description from the publisher

Name: Wazooga
Description:
You have been captured by aliens and put in their zoo. All players are trying to escape in the shortest time possible.  As you perform actions, you pay hours to accomplish each one. You are searching for food for the trip, robots to navigate the alien ship you must steal, other captured aliens to help you carry all the stuff, and weapons to deal with inevitable guards you will encounter. Early in the game the food and robots are plentiful and cost very few hours to find--alien friends and weapons take longer to find.  As the game progresses food and robots become harder to find and aliens become easier to recruit. Weapons also become easier to find as the guards become aware of your plans and bring in more firepower. As you draw items (cubes) you may also trip an alarm. This means that all sources of food, robots, hiding places, and weapons will be moved to new locations and you will have to face guards. As you carry more things, you move slower, but alien allies can help. They can help you find items more quickly, fight guards, carry items and scout new supplies. Your struggle ends when you find the escape ship and have enough food and robots to leave. But this may not be the end of the game.  You must still defeat the guards watching the ship.  Then other players can still beat the first player to escape if they can spend less hours to get out.

—description from the designer

Name: Buried Treasure
Description:
Arrrr!  It's time to set off and find your fortune!  Beware of other scurvy dogs while ye do it!

Buried Treasure is a 2-4 team game where sides compete with each other search, dig up, and escape with a treasure buried on an unhospitable island.  While the game is written from a fantasical pirate point-of-view, you can really substitute is scenario into any genre when you need your players to avoid being killed by natives, nature, and each other while trying to retrieve the hidden item.

The set up drives the different teams to move all over the board while trying to gain an advantage, so no turtling.  There are false leads and deception built into the system, so the drama unfolds incrementally over time.  And after all that intrigue, the final phase almost unerringly leads to a nice little blood bath, to work out the tension.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hooked
Description:
You take on the role of a fisherman. The weather conditions are perfect so nothing can stop you from having a nice catch. Nothing except for the other fishermen. Be the one that catches the most valuable fish. Sabotage others by contaminating their fishing lines with trash or by sending sharks, pelicans and even the mythical Kraken at them!

Each player receives 5 cards they must use to cast their lines and catch fish. On a player’s turn, he must place one card on the table. He can choose whether he places this card underneath his fisherman or beneath a component’s.

The game ends when 1 player has caught 5 fish. However, the winner is the fisherman who caught the fish with the highest value. The deeper you fish, the more valuable the fish can be.
  
Can you cope with the dangers of the sea and even catch the Kraken? Or will the pelicans steal all your fish away and make you go home empty-handed?

—description from the publisher

Name: NATO Goes Nuts: The Coming Polish-German War
Description:
NATO Goes Nuts: The Coming Polish-German War. As America withdraws from the world, there will be vast repercussions. In Europe, the international security guarantees put in place in 1945 will be gone. That will mean the old national rivalries that twice in 30 years sent the continent into world wars will reemerge. The scenario here covers Central Europe, where the presumed near-future emergence in Germany of the ultra-nationalist AFD as the majority party ignites fear and loathing in Poland.

The Poles understand the overarching fact of their national existence is this: if Russia and Germany are both strong at the same time, independent Poland is doomed. Russia is already relatively strong and armed with atomic weapons; it’s therefore too late for anything to be done about that.  To the west of Poland, an AFD-run Germany would no doubt soon rearm and become strong. The Poles therefore resolve to act before that happens. They strike into eastern Germany with the objective of taking Berlin and setting up a compliant and friendly regime there. Alternatively, we can also postulate a Poland that continues its own recent drift toward the far right, culminating in a quasi-fascist government in Warsaw. That regime might act in order to forestall a nascent far-right German regime, or it might move against even a moderate-left German regime in order to forestall further Muslim immigration into Central Europe.

The game uses a battalion-level evolution of the alternating action system from America Falling to model this near-future war in Central Europe. One large-hex 34x22” map covering all of eastern Germany at five miles per hex (8 km), along with one sheet of 228 medium-size (9/16”) counters. Rules cover such things as the possibility of Czech intervention on the German side and a Turkish-Islamist uprising in Muslim sections of Berlin. Playable by two people in one sitting and also solitaire adaptable.

Product Information:
Complexity: 6 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 8 out of 10
Map Scale: 5 miles (8 km) per hex 
Playing Time: four to six hours

Name: SUGOIGP: Super Ultra Great Overd Incredible Grand Prix
Description:
Compete in the ranking by clearing many obstacles.
The person with the highest victory score at the time of goal is the winner.

The game starts with choosing a machine and a driver. Once the race begins, you cannot change or change.

When the driver gets into the machine, it is ready. At the start of the game you will receive a random colored cube on the entry card and driver card

The basics of this game is to clear the obstacles (themes) of the arranged course cards . However, it does not mean that a course card is loaded with a cube each time. You need to load cubes for several course cards up to the next checkpoint.

Use the square on the left side of the machine card.
Stack cubes along this area.

The stacked cubes are judged from two directions, from directly in front and directly above, so you can deal with them with inspiration and ingenuity!

Let's start the race!

—description from the publisher

Name: Operation Storm: Stalin's Barbarossa
Description:
Operation Storm: Stalin's Barbarossa   What if the Soviets Attacked First in 1941?

Operation Storm is a two-player, low-to-intermediate complexity, strategic simulation of the campaign that could've resulted had Stalin agreed to Gen. Georg Zhukov's plan for a preemptive attack against the Germans. The Soviet player is mainly on the offensive, attempting to win the game by seizing key objectives within the territory of the Third Reich. At the same time, though, the situation allows for--and at times demands--the launching of sharp counteroffensives by the German player.

Each hexagon on the map represents 16 miles (26 kilometers) from side to opposite side. The units of maneuver for both sides are primarily divisions, along with a few units of other organizational sizes. Each full game turn represents from two weeks to two months, depending on the season. By telescoping time in that way, the turn-by-turn movement and combat capacities of the units can held as a constant. The game map illustrates the militarily significant terrain found in the border area between the Third Reich and the USSR in mid-1941 when viewed at these time and space scales.

The initial orders of battle for both sides are drawn from the forces historically available to both sides in early June 1941. Similarly, on the Soviet side, the reinforcement schedule is based on what was generated by them during the historic campaign, minus only the historic emergency mobilization of the militia divisions.

The Soviet player is generally on the offensive, striving to win by seizing important areas on the map while causing heavy casualties on the opposing side. The German wins by preventing his opponent from fulfilling the Soviet victory conditions. Unless one player assesses his situation to have become hopeless, and therefore capitulates to this opponent, victory is only judged at the end of Game Turn 10. There are no “sudden death” victories in this game. Soviet performance in that regard is based on that side side’s accumulation of victory points.

Name: Virtue Signal: Problematic Card Pack
Description:
16 excruciatingly illustrated microaggression and virtue signal cards of the salt and vinegar variety.

—description from the publisher

Name: ParaDice: Luck and Fortune
Description:
There are two game modes you can enjoy and none of them are suitable for sore losers.

In “Luck” all dice are rolled and you must choose one of your cards of number or color. You will take all dice that matches your card, but if any other player chose the same card, you both lose. Each dice gives you one point and the first to get ten or more points wins the game.

In “Fortune” you pick one color card and one number card. Only one dice for each color are rolled. If one dice matches your cards you win. If not, you can reroll one dice or change one of your cards. But beware, you might favor the fortune of another player.

—description from the publisher

Name: Troll Ball
Description:
Troll Ball is a rousing game of athleticism, strategy, and havok for INLGames' free Quick Intermediate Level Skirmish rules.

The premise is simple - get the ball to the goal.  
In practice, this can be a bit of a challenge.  
The trolls on your team will have to kick true and think ahead.  
Cracking a head is not a bad idea, either.  
But be mindful of the traditions of Troll Ball.  
Capital punishment is on tap for those who loose the ball in the woods.  
And if you kill another troll, your entire team will be sent to a time out!

This .pdf includes:

9 Pages of rules
    6 Pages of 2D and 2.5D terrain pieces
    Examples of play
    Setups for 2-10 players (well, except 7 players - that just never worked right in playtesting)
    Enough variants to keep this game kicking for years

—description from the publisher

Name: Natural Chaos
Description:
The world of nature is in chaos and it up to you to bring back order!

Natural Chaos is an abstract strategy game where each player controls two natural elements. The goal is to get four of your elements in a row on one of the four playing boards. But watch out the elements have a four way rock paper scissors type ranking system that allows you to keep your opponent on their toes!

—description from the publisher

Name: Reforge Worlds: Volume I
Description:
Take Reforge to new worlds with the first expansion pack to the sword crafting, battle royale card game. This pack introduces d12 blades, along with new game-changing gadgets.

Includes three new worlds:
Deep Space
Faraway Land
Kickstarter Forge

—description from the publisher

Name: Cambrai to Sinai: Wargame Rules for WWII and all Land Warfare in the Period 1917-1967
Description:
A set of miniatures wargames rules.

Scale:
1/300 to 1/72

"These Rules are a development of the World War II Infantry Action Set published by Leicester Micro Models, of which they form a Second Edition. They have been developed and extended to cover the period 1917 to 1967 by the inclusion of additional weapons, and modified to enable large scale micro tank actions to be fought. The provision for both small scale infantry actions and large scale task battles in one set is unique.

An alternate movement and firing system has been introduced to speed up play and simplify the umpire role. Alternate movement is justifiable on the basis that battle in recent times tend to consist of series of short movements from firing position to firing position, It has been adopted by other authors in this period recently"

—description from the designer

Name: Office Work
Description:
Serpy the snake has lots of problems! He had an accident and all the important files got mixed. With few minutes before the meeting, Serpy is going to need all the hands he can get... but who will help him?

Office Work is a Cooperative Party Game where you work at an office without any experience on paperwork. A game is played in 4 rounds on real time, of 4 to 3 minutes each round; the players must organize the "Important Files" Cards by color and number, depending what the "Work Cards" show and also don't forget to introduce the "Work Card" into the Time Clock to score it! You might need to put them in ascending order, in an specific code or even rotating! Also you must serve the coffee for the bosses, take the coffee pot and serve 3 Coffee Tokens in your cup and don't forget to take the sugar cubes with the tweezers to serve exactly 2 Cubes into the cup.

When the time is over, players are going to check if they did a good job, if at least one card of the same group of "Important Files" is incorrect, everything will be wrong! losing Prestige Stars; if any coffee token or sugar cube fall on the floor or table you are going to lose Prestige Stars for making a mess so beware. If you must lose more Prestige Stars than you have, everyone loses.

Survive the 4 rounds with at least 1 Prestige Star to win the game!

Serve the coffee, organize the files and try to not to make a mess!

—description from the publisher

Name: Crazier Eights: Olympus
Description:
A gateway fantasy card game in the world of Greek mythology with gods, heroes, and other aspects of the stories.

The game consists in a 52 card deck. Every card has a unique ability. The first player with 0 cards in hand wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: MAYA!
Description:
Background

In the Myth story of Maya culture, the twins Hunahpu and Xbalanque occasionally found their talent in kicking soccer.
They played soccer everyday and had practiced it really hard.
However, the Gods in underground were finally provoked since the twins were too noisy.
The Gods summon Hunahpu and Xbalanque to underground and force them to take a series of terrific trials in different rooms where filled with dancing swords made with dragonglass or bloody bats that could eat their heads off.
If the twins can pass these trials they can get to have a final soccer battle with the Gods.

Gameplay
The players are acting the fans of the twins and will have to assist them to complete the rooms challenges.
The fast player who helps the twins to complete the challenges will get the bonus.
The player with most bonus points will win the game and get to witness the final battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alliances
Description:
This tricky game requires you to connect opposite sides of the board: purple to purple, orange to orange, green to green. To make those connections, you must use the colour matching the sides you are connecting… but your allied colour also works!

COMPONENTS


      1 gameboard
      42 green discs
      42 orange discs
      42 purple discs
      2 silver discs


GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW (please refer to the rulebook)

On your turn, take a disc from the supply and place it on any empty space.

If you just formed a connection between opposite sides, with an uninterrupted chain of tiles of the sides’ colour and/or the allied colour, you win that colour, even if the disc you placed formed a connection for both of you.

When you win a colour, take a disc of that colour from the supply and place it on the corresponding cell of your chart, while your opponent places a silver disc on the same colour on their chart (they lost that colour). If you just won your second colour, you win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Velodrome
Description:
Velodrome is a game about indoor cycle racing. Each turn, every player selects a speed for their bike. Will they wait out the others and save their energy, or start to race for the finish line? Passing the line gives a number of points according to a cube drawn — but the next pass may be much more valuable! Furthermore, the used speed tiles are passed to your opponents.

The first person to reach a certain number of points wins.

Name: Rally Cross
Description: Rally Cross is a racing game across a winding track on the wooden board. Every turn, players select their movement by picking a stick of a certain length - and then use that stick to meter out their move, preferably without rushing into anything!

Name: Bowling the Card Game
Description:
Bowling the Card Game is a light, simple, fun game that simulates bowling using a special deck of cards.

This game was designed and created by five siblings aged 4-14.  They were inspired to create a fun, realistic bowling game by their grandfather who is a passionate bowler. The result was Bowling the Card Game.

The game involves hand management and press your luck as the players try to deal with troublesome splits, and hoping for that one perfect card to complete a spare.  It also reinforces basic math skills through learning to keep score and add up your totals.

Deluxe Edition comes with bowling score pad.

Name: Battles Before Time: Knucklebones (Dice) Edition – A Prehistoric Fantasy Miniatures Game
Description:
Battles Before Time: Knucklebones (Dice) Edition is a revised version of the original Battles Before Time game published in 2016. Instead of the "stone draw" mechanic used in the original version, the Knucklebones Edition uses dice. We created this edition due to many requests for a streamlined version of the game that just uses good old dice.

Battles Before Time is a prehistoric fantasy miniatures skirmish game for 28mm figures (as well as plastic dinosaurs & giant mammals that more or less fit with 28mm cavemen). The game is set in an alternate prehistory where our Human ancestors – the Early Modern Humans, or Emohs for short – rub elbows with Neanderthals, Dino sapiens (dinosaur men), Florz (small Emohs), & other species. Dinosaurs, huge mammals, & monsters also roam the Earth, & shamans can use powerful magic.

The game consists of two parts. Part One is 26 pages long; it contains the rules (the core rules are only seven pages long) as well as a guide to the cavemen & creatures that will make up your warband. Warbands include cavemen or dinosaur men who can purchase special abilities, weapons, armor, cavepunk items, & spells. Warbands can also include heroes, dinosaurs, mammals, prehistoric “birds”, aquatic beasts, & prehistoric monsters.

Part One begins with an Introduction & Game Overview. Next, scale, items needed to play, & information on setting up the game are presented. The rules themselves have the following sections: Game Turns & Actions, Actions When Activated, Darwinian Measurement, Movement, Going Prone, Language (or the Lack Thereof), Action Rolls, Contests, Combat, Doing Damage, Area Effect Attacks, Panic, & End of the Game/Victory!

Next, Part One covers how to make your warband. There's information about units & unit types (mostly Packs of Grunts), crew & riders, & heroes. After that, you'll find out about how to use beast masters to control the huge variety of prehistoric beasts included.

To defend your cavemen against these creatures, you'll find lots of prehistoric weapons, armor, cavepunk technology, standards, torches, & watercraft. You can also include shamans who cast magic spells.

Part Two contains detailed instructions on how to create your warband. Players can use one of the pre-made warbands provided, or can create their own balanced warbands using a simple point build system. Part Two is 75 pages long & includes templates, more than 100 unit cards, all the tokens you’ll need, a terrain placement guide, & measuring sticks. You supply the cavemen, dinosaurs, & other prehistoric figures, & we'll give you a fun excuse to play with them on a tabletop!

So, stop shaving! Stop bathing! Grab a club, and let’s rock & roll!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Blighted Lands: An Expansion to Five Leagues from the Borderlands
Description:
Endless sands, fierce nomad tribes and wildlife that will eat your face off.
Why did we come here again?

In this expansion pack for Five Leagues from the Borderlands, you can visit a new region: The Blighted Lands.

Offering new encounter tables with new enemies to fight, this is meant to slot into the existing rulebook campaign as easily as possible to increase the variation and fun you can have in the game.

In addition to 17 new enemies to fight, rules include all the details you need to adventure in this harsh land.

New mechanics include the chance for enemy Leaders to gain experience of their own, new "Story" and "Star" options and the long-awaited rules for fighting on horseback.

No new skills or loot is available this time, but you can bring your horse with you back to the civilized world.

All for the price of a cup of coffee.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Five Leagues From the Borderland

Name: Vegas Slot Machine 1973
Description:
Slot machine theme card game. Solo, competitive, co-operative or in teams.

Content: 72 symbol cards, 4 prize/score cards, 4 Spin Again cards (expansion 1), 3 Cumber cards (expansion 2) and the rules.

Rules in one minute:


     All players draw 3 cards in their hand
     Lay down 9 cards (3x3 grid) to make the slotmachine
     On your turn: put down 1 card from your hand and try to make 3 of the same symbols on a winning line
     3 of the same symbols on a winning line is a prize
     Collect your prizes and keep them untill the end of the game
     At the end of the game all players count their prizes and write down their credit points
     You can play up to four games (10 minutes per game)
     The player with the most credit points wins the game


A few things you can't do:


     Don't put a symbol card on top of a card with the same symbol
     Don't put a symbol card on top of a symbol that is already a part of a combination of two of the same symbols in a winning line
     Never put a symbol card on top of the ANY symbol


—description from the publisher

Name: Air Combat 1930-1960
Description:
Air Combat 1930-1960

These rules are designed to represent aerial combats in the period 1930 to 1960 in the form of a wargame on a table top. They may be used in conjunction with Cambrai to Sinai Rules for combined action involving ground forces.

The rules are basically simple but require a thorough understanding to produce a satisfactory representation of 3 dimensional aerial combats, it is thus advisable that players familiarise themselves thoroughly with the movement and firing systems before attempting to play a full game.

Scales:
Horizontal scale 1:2000 i.e. 1mm = 2m (15mm = 30m)
Time is divided in 2 second moves (1/15th with Cambrai to Sinai)
Vertical movement is shown on the Altitude Move Speed Chart in terms of 100 ft (30m) intervals (scale unspecified)

Movement patterns are used and provided in the game. 
A protractor and measuring tapes are required.

Data for 140 aircraft types is provided.

-Extract from the rulebook introduction description

Name: Lovelace & Babbage: Tantrum House 2019 Promo Card
Description:
Promo card available through the Tantrum House 2019 kickstarter campaign.

This is a patron card that demands a 78 and gets you a yellow or a green influence.

Name: Batman: The Animated Series Adventures – Mask of the Phantasm Expansion
Description:
The Mask of the Phantasm story pack adds Bruce Wayne as a new playable hero, and the Phantasm, who can be played as either a villain or hero. In the Mask of the Phantasm campaign, the Phantasm operates like a third faction in each battle. While not directly opposing the heroes, the Phantasm isn't exactly allied with them either. Each battle in Mask of the Phantasm will have the heroes trying to stop the villains, while also racing against the shadowy threat of the Phantasm! Bruce Wayne comes with a Hero Sheet and 6 Hero Skill cards, the Phantasm comes with a Hero Sheet, 6 Hero Skill cards, a A.I. Villain Sheet, a 4v1 Villain Sheet, and 6 Villain Ability cards, and the mission book includes a 3-battle campaign following the events of the motion picture.

—description from the publisher
Families: TV Shows: Batman – The Animated Series

Name: Battle of the Bards: Tantrum House 2019 promo card
Description:
promo card available through the Tantrum House 2019 kickstarter campaign

This is an audience card :
cost : 3 performance tokens (any color)
VP : 5
ability : When you use the Roadie's ability, you may gain another tune token

Name: Batman: The Animated Series Adventures – Mystery of the Batwoman Expansion
Description:
The Mystery of the Batwoman story pack adds Batwoman as a playable hero and Bane as a new villain. Batwoman is an extremely flexible hero as the identity of the woman under the cowl changes the way she plays. Fight alongside this new mysterious ally as you work to stop one of Batman's greatest foes, the hulking Bane! Batwoman comes with a set of 3 custom dice, a Hero Sheet, and 6 Hero Skill cards, Bane comes with a A.I. Villain Sheet, 4v1 Villain Sheet, and 6 Villain Ability cards, and the mission book includes a 3-battle campaign following the events of the motion picture.

—description from the publisher
Families: TV Shows: Batman – The Animated Series

Name: Batman: The Animated Series Adventures – The New Batman Adventures Expansion
Description:
The New Batman Adventures character pack adds 2 new heroes and 2 new villains to your AUGS roster.  Play as the nimble Tim Drake, recently adorning the title of Robin, or take to the skies as the experienced Nightwing. However, new heroes bring new foes! Can these two new do-gooders stop the calculating Calendar Girl, or the destructive Firefly, who sets the map ablaze as he attacks? Each hero comes with a set of 3 custom dice, a Hero Sheet, and 6 Hero Skill cards. Each Villain comes with a A.I. Villain Sheet, 4v1 Villain Sheet, and 6 Villain Ability cards.

—description from the publisher
Families: TV Shows: Batman – The Animated Series

Name: Tools of War: An expansion pack for Five Leagues from the Borderlands (Second Edition)
Description:
Tools of War expands your Five Leagues from the Borderlands experience.

Within this pack, you will find:

     5 new trade items you can buy for your war band, including hand crossbows and boot knives.
     6 new treasures to loot, including Fey draughts and Southern spices.
     5 new character skills, including Rationing and Quick Witted.
     A new location you can look for in any village you visit: "Old Rolmar's pre-owned swords" letting you gamble a bit when purchasing weapons, as well as a place to sell off gear.


This pack can be added to any Five Leagues campaign on the fly.

There is no need to start over when adding the new options and you can use as many or as few as you like.

This 2nd edition contains the same items as the original, but the rules have been updated as well as checked for 2nd edition compatibility.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Five Leagues From the Borderland

Name: Batman: The Animated Series Adventures – Villain Upgrade Pack Expansion
Description:
New to the Adventures Universal Game System are "Rogues Gallery" class dice, which offer a whole new level of flexibility when playing as a hero! Normally, hero characters have one set of custom dice that is balanced for them to have a particular play style. However, villains are a bit more slippery than that. With class dice, you can change the way your character plays. Want to play The Joker as the traditional slick footed trickster? Then use the "Wildcard" dice! Want to switch it up and show how deadly he can be with a blunt object? Then swap in the "Brawler" dice (better watch out, Robin). Combining different Rogues Gallery class dice with your character's various hero skill cards generates even more ways to customize their play style.

In addition to the 12 new dice, the Villains Upgrade Pack comes with 10 Hero Sheets: The Joker, Mr. Freeze, Killer Croc, Poison Ivy, Harley Quinn, Two-Face, Penguin, Scarecrow, Jervis Tetch, and The Riddler, a set of Hero Skill cards for those 10 characters, totaling 72 new Skill cards, 9 A.I. Villain sheets for Batman, Robin, Batgirl, Commissioner Gordon, Detective Montoya, Detective Bullock, Nightwing, Tim Drake, and the GCPD beat cops, and 25 initiative cards.

On top of all that, the Villain Upgrade Pack also contains a new mission book. Based on the episode Almost Got 'Im, this mission book delivers a new campaign type: a skirmish campaign. Skirmish campaigns have multiple hero players and multiple villains players using all characters on the board in their hero playstyle, rolling dice and strategizing with their teammates. In Almost Got 'Im a team of villains and a team of heroes will square off to settle the score once and for all. Players that want to keep things strictly cooperative can play this campaign in the cooperative A.I. mode.

—description from the publisher
Families: TV Shows: Batman – The Animated Series

Name: TACTIX: Universal Wargame Rules
Description:
Tired of the same old game with no flavor and no balance?
     Restricted with your army list and the options you have?
     Struggling to get the most out of your miniature collection?
     Looking for a system that allows for large-scale wargaming and skirmish level campaign play?
     Love the models in your collection but hate the rules made by that company?


Look no further! This is the wargame you've been searching for. TACTIX is a wargame that allows for ultimate customization for each and every model in your collection while providing a balanced and streamlined ruleset for you to use for any genre or type of wargame!

—description from the publisher

TACTIX is a generic system that supports two or more players using any type of forces, from historical to science-fantasy.  A simple procedure is used to assign individual models several ratings, including Assault, Shoot, and Quality.  Models' size is determined by the physical base size of the figure, and is divided into seven categories (each category other than Normal has an assigned Trait).  A relatively simple method is then used to calculate the model's cost in points, and players take (roughly) the same number of base points for their army.

Play proceeds in turns, round-robin style.  Games have a pre-determined length and end when the time is reached (or when all but one player concedes).  Games have pre-determined objectives with associated points; alternately, victory can be determined by remaining model points.  During their turn, players have several options available for each model, depending on the model's individual Trait(s).

The game is distributed as a rule book only.  Models used during play can be derived from nearly any source, as desired, and may be of almost any scale, though 32mm through 400mm bases would by typical.

—user summary

Name: Variant Rules Pack 1: For Dungeon Scum and Starport Scum
Description:
One of the beauties of the Scum system is that it is extremely easy to customize to provide exactly the type of game the group wants.
...
Unless otherwise noted, these rules are applicable to both Dungeon Scum and Starport Scum, though you may find a particular option more suitable to one or the other.

—description from the rulebook

The Variant Rules Pack provides a collection of new options for your games of both Starport Scum and Dungeon Scum, ranging from the exceptionally simple to the more involved.

Inside, you will find 17 variant rules, covering everything from making the game more or less deadly, more options for sneaking around the battle, outflanking enemies, new initiative options and rules for first aid and dodging in combat.

As a bonus you also get a gnarly table for determining the effects of a Gruesome Death result.

—description from the publisher

These expansion rules require one or both of the base games.  They provide rule-by-rule options and variants.  Each variant rule essentially is modular, and players can pick-and-choose which options to use.

—user summary

Name: Winterborne: Tantrum House 2019 promo card
Description:
Promo card available through the 2019 Tantrum House kickstarter campaign.

This forest card lets you spend any resource and take a sacked spoils token.

Name: Gone Caving!
Description:
Gone Caving is a card game in which you and your friends are exploring an underground world together. You can compete with each other, or choose to work together to discover the most passage possible. During your journey you’ll discover beautiful cave formations and curious animals.  There will be challenges along the way, but you can overcome them and then find your way back to the surface.

Players first find a cave entrance, then explore cave passages, overcome challenges, and exit the cave safely to end. Score points by tallying the lengths of cave passage explored; get bonus points for specializing in one or more areas of cave research such as geology, biology, or cartography. Each of 104 cards is illustrated and based on accurate depictions of the formations, animals, and equipment that cavers encounter in the underground world. On each turn, a player draws a card and plays or discards a card. They may: play a card in their own play area to gain points or skills or to resolve a challenge;
or play a challenge in another player’s area; or discard a card with no effect.

A large portion of the proceeds from the game benefit the National Speleological Society (NSS).

—description from the designer

Name: Tank Duel: Expansion #1 – North Africa
Description:
Tank Duel Expansion #1: North Africa takes the popular Tank Duel system to the desert! North Africa introduces new desert terrain and rules for dust, deep sand, armored cars, heat and haze, and more. British and Italian tanks join the fight, alongside even more German AFVs:
 Panzer IV Ausf. E
Marder II
Panzer III Ausf. F
Sd.Kfz. 232 Rad-8
Semovente da 75/18
M13/40
More Tigers!
M4A2 Sherman III
Cruiser Mk. IV A13
Matilda Mk. II A12
Crusader Mk. II A15
Valentine Mk. II
Churchill Mk. IV
Valentine Mk. VIII
 Tank Duel: North Africa includes ID Counters allowing you to assign any ID Number to each tank, enabling players to combine the tank boards from multiple Tank Duel sets in order to create new tank matchups, or have 4 Tigers mix it up! North Africa also comes with brand new scenarios, including new historical scenarios for you to test your crews. Tanks and terrain from North Africa can be combined with some scenarios from Enemy in the Crosshairs to give you even more ways to play Tank Duel!
 North Africa supports the popular Robata system from Enemy in the Crosshairs and will have new Robata compatible scenarios, and additional rules for Robata to handle desert terrain and new AFVs. From Egypt to Morocco, Tank Duel Expansion #1: North Africa allows you to experience the sun, heat, sand and grit of World War II like never before!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tank Duel: Tank Pack #1
Description:
Tank Duel Tank Pack #1 adds 8 new tanks to the popular Tank Duel system. These tanks can be mixed with the existing tanks and used in scenarios from both Tank Duel: Enemy in the Crosshairs and Tank Duel Expansion #1: North Africa. Two of each of these new tanks are included in Tank Pack #1: 
KV-1
T-26
M3 Lee
M3 Stuart Mk II (“Honey”)
Panzer IV Ausf. F/2
Panzer III Ausf. G
Sd.Kfz. 234 “Puma”
Panzer 38(t) Ausf. C

Tank Pack #1 also includes rules for armored cars, tanks with multiple turrets, and light ordnance, in addition to 8 all-new scenarios. Two Tank Packs can be combined with Tank Duel Expansion #1: North Africa to enable 4 of each type of tank to battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kersplatt!
Description:
Kersplatt! is the hilarious, fast-paced, family board game of modelling mayhem!  A high energy, tactile but strategic board game that will see players Kersplatting opponents’ creative masterpieces in the quest to be the first to get two play pieces home.

First players have to get creative and make their own play pieces with the modelling dough provided, then it is all to play for! Taking it in turns to turn over a card, players try to advance their play pieces as far as they can around the board whilst trying to stop their opponents from reaching their Home square first.

There are three types of card: a Coloured Number Card allows you to advance your play piece to the nearest empty space either matching the colour of the card or the number on the card. A Choice of Two Colours Card allow you to choose the colour that advances you the further around the board. The third type of card is the Kersplatt or Colour Card; with this card you can choose to either advance to the further colour space or take your hand, starting from your own start space, travel along the path until you reach the first opponent’s play piece and Kersplatt it! Once a play piece has been Kersplatted it remains on the board making that area a dead space that cannot be landed on.

Kersplatt! is a fantastic 2-4 player family board game where strategy and tactics definitely come into play.  Perfect for players age 6 years and over. (/Description from publisher's website)

—description from the publisher

Name: Martial Art: Divorce Simulator Promo
Description: A new legend for use with Martial Art which was included as a promo for Divorce Simulator. Like the other legends,
